text.title: Ontario Votes 2007: Interview with Family Coalition Party candidate Bill McMaster, Lambton — Kent — Middlesex

head.s: Coalition Party candidate Bill McMaster , Lambton — Kent — Middlesex

p.s: is running for the Family Coalition Party in the Ontario provincial election , in the Lambton — Kent — Middlesex riding .
Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .

s.hi: Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?

p.s: Partly because I have always been interested in to politics of the country , and because I do not believe in the Progressive Conservatives School funding program .
I felt that as a conservative , I could not support it .
The Family Coalition Party best represents my political views at this time .

s.hi: Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?

p.s: I live in the riding .

s.hi: What prior political experience do you have ?

p.s: Limited .
Church politics , local hockey politics

s.hi: What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?

p.s: I am not afraid to ask the hard questions or challenge a position even if it causes controversy

s.hi: Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?

p.s: The conservative or the liberal .
The conservative because he IS one of the good guys , although he has to follow the agenda of the leader , and the liberal because she is the incumbent .

s.hi: What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?

p.s: I am the only candidate willing to speak openly against abortion and the marriage issues .

s.hi: What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?

p.s: Health care , education , and farming .

s.hi: Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?

p.s: Yes .

s.hi: What would you do to address these issues ?

p.s: The Family Coalition Party has a platform for Health and Education .
Has started a platform for farming , but believes that farmers voices are needed , not just politicos .

s.hi: What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?

p.s: Cut taxes .

s.hi: Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?

p.s: No.

s.hi: How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?

p.s: Cut taxes across the board and put more money in peoples pockets .

s.hi:
What are your views on the
mixed member proportional representation
( MMP ) referendum ?

p.s: I 'm unsure , but leaning toward no , only for the reason that I believe there are better ways than the one proposed .

hi.s: What role , if any , does “ new media ” play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc ) Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?

p.s: I have a lot of support from www.freedominion.com , a site of principled conservatism .
Other candidates for the party are also members there , and the owner is running for the Freedom Party .
The other sites are helpful as far as finding out information , but freedominion is still by far the best source of information , and you are required to provide proof of what you post .

hi.s: Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
To the province as a whole ?
Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
To the province as a whole ?

p.s: Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
To the province as a whole ?
Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
To the province as a whole ?
I do n’t know if any were beneficial , I know the health care tax and the largest tax increase in Ontario ’s history was certainly detrimental as it hurt the auto sector in this area .
Schools have been closed , and hospitals have cut essential staff but created more management .
As far as anything coming from the liberal camp , I do n’t see much in the way of benefits .
